senses.sense_definition: A poet or minstrel in Anglo-Saxon England who recited poetry and told stories.

examples.text: The <w>scop</w> entertained the warriors in the mead hall with tales of heroism and ancient battles.
In Anglo-Saxon society, the <w>scop</w> played a vital role in preserving history through oral tradition.

senses.sense_definition: Initialism of seasonal coefficient of performance; a measure of a heat pump's efficiency over a heating season.

examples.text: The new heat pump boasts a high <w>SCOP</w>, making it very energy efficient throughout the winter.
Engineers calculate the <w>SCOP</w> to determine the system's average performance over the entire season.
